channel.title: Auto News | Latest Automobiles & Auto Industry Information and Updates: ET Auto : ETAuto.com
channel.description: Find the latest automobile Auto Insight, News & Articles from all top sources for the Indian Auto industry on ET Auto.

enclosure.title: Top Auto News | Latest Automobiles & Auto Industry Information and Updates: ET Auto : ETAuto.com

item.title: Hyundai, Kia showcase integrated air taxi service tech
item.description: Hyundai Motor and Kia, South Korea's leading automotive companies, on Monday held a joint demonstration for their integrated air taxi service technology in Indonesia, the companies said.

item.title: Musk to discuss USD 5 bn xAI investment with Tesla board
item.description: Musk, the world's richest person, launched xAI last year in a bid to compete with Microsoft-backed OpenAI. That sparked concerns he may allocate some resources of the automaker to the AI company.

item.title: India is still some time away from experiencing V2X technology
item.description: The automotive industry is witnessing a surge in connected vehicles with V2X technology. For experiencing V2X technology at a large scale in India, people will have to wait for a few more years as per industry experts.

item.title: A new wave of electric vehicles are ready to charge at 70 mph
item.description: Despite the advances in electric vehicle range, range anxiety persists. Hybrid models, such as the forthcoming Ramcharger, use gas engines to charge batteries, offering an interim solution. These hybrids cater to drivers hesitant to fully embrace electric vehicles amidst slow-charging infrastructure improvements, blending electric efficiency with gasoline reliability.

item.title: Thailand to offer investment incentives for makers of hybrid vehicles
item.description: "Thailand has the capacity to be a key producer of hybrid vehicles ... and supporting hybrid production will preserve auto parts manufacturing," he said, adding the measures are expected to draw in 50 billion baht (USD 1.39 billion) worth of investments.

item.title: JioThings,MediaTek partner for indigenously made smart IoT tech for 2 wheeler EVs
item.description: "Jio Things is pleased to collaborate with MediaTek to revolutionize the Mobility industry with our 4G Smart Android Digital Cluster, App Suite and Smart Module solutions," Jio Platforms, President and CEO, Kiran Thomas said.

item.title: Google Maps to alert about road widths, flyovers, EV charging stations in India
item.description: "To address this, we've developed an AI model specifically for Indian roads that incorporates multiple signals -- satellite imagery, Street View, and other information like road types, distance between buildings, paved sections, etc. to estimate road widths at scale," informed Miriam Daniel, VP and GM, Google Maps.

item.title: The lower the AI exposure, the bigger the problem for Europe's chip firms
item.description: Companies with less AI exposure meanwhile were hit harder by industrial clients and automakers cutting orders. Demand for electric vehicles has slowed sharply in Europe.

item.title: NXP slides as weak forecast stokes demand worries among auto chipmakers
item.description: As a result, CEO Sievers expects 2024 annual revenue to decline in the low single-digit range. NXP expects internal inventory levels to start coming down in the fourth quarter and get back in order in 2025.

item.title: GM slams brakes on self-driving vehicle without steering wheel
item.description: GM will instead use a conventional next-generation Bolt EV as the platform for its Cruise robotaxi, a move that will not require permission of U.S. regulators.

item.title: Sodium-ion batteries are set to spark a renewable energy revolution - and Australia must be ready
item.description: Energy storage collects excess energy generated by renewables, stores it then releases it on demand, to help ensure a reliable supply. Such facilities provide either short or long-term (more than 100 hours) storage. At present, lithium-ion batteries are the primary storage technology but are best for short-term storage. Sodium-ion batteries are now almost ready to fill the long-term storage gap.

item.title: Indian Navy partners with Indian Oil to test green hydrogen fuel cell buses
item.description: The Indian Navy and Indian Oil signed an MoU at Nau Sena Bhawan for green hydrogen fuel cell buses. Adm. Dinesh K Tripathi and S M Vaidya formalized the partnership. Vice Adm. Deepak Kapoor was present. IndianOil operates 15 buses in Delhi-NCR and Gujarat, totaling 300,000 km, aiming for sustainable transport.

item.title: Amara Raja Energy & Mobility partners with IIT Tirupati for advanced energy storage technologies
item.description: The agreement was announced during an event at IIT Tirupati, attended by notable figures, including Shri Jayadev Galla, Chairman and Managing Director of ARE&M, Shri Sajjan Jindal, Chairman of BoG, IIT Tirupati, Sri Kris Gopalakrishnan, Chairman of Axilor Ventures and Co-founder of Infosys, and Dr. Ramadevei Gourineni.

item.title: Ahamani EV Tech explores technology transfer opportunities to Indian auto companies
item.description: Ahamani's UrDa AIOT Mobility System, which has been operational since 2017, plays a crucial role in managing electric two-wheeler fleets and battery packs. The company has also patented an e-Scooter rental management system and a leasing program, both of which have received widespread recognition. With over 20 years of experience in the electric vehicle industry, Ahamani emphasizes innovation and quality.

item.title: Past, present & future of EVs: Advanced battery technology is key to success
item.description: It is obvious that in India, incentives alone will not work to meet the target of 30% EV sales by 2030 as the future of EVs will depend on technological innovations, especially battery technology. Sufficient investments have to be made for development of lithium mines discovered in J&K.

item.title: IAC urges automakers towards Auto LPG for lower emissions and costs
item.description: The IAC urges OEMs like Maruti Suzuki to adopt Auto LPG, which emits 20% less CO2, 60% less diesel, nearly no particulate matter, and is 40% cheaper. Conversion costs INR 30,000. It's a competitive, sustainable option for stricter norms. Globally, 27 million vehicles use Auto LPG, showing significant growth.

item.title: Tata Technologies partners with Arm to drive innovation in SDVs
item.description: In this partnership, Tata Technologies will develop a SOAFEE reference architecture stack using Arm's Automotive Enhanced (AE) technologies and Arm Compute Subsystems (CSS) for Automotive. This development will be supported by a cloud-native framework that integrates various DevSecOps and virtual platform solutions, accelerating the time to market for automakers.

item.title: Jitendra EV announces new upgrades for JMT Model
item.description: With a starting price of INR 70,000, the JMT model is an economical solution for businesses transitioning to electric vehicles and consumers looking for eco-friendly travel options. The robust design ensures durability and lower maintenance costs, making it ideal for both commercial and residential users. Features include a split rear seat for comfort and a spacious cargo area, making it suitable for delivering food, groceries, dairy products, pharmacy items, and more. It's also a viable option for personal commuting.

item.title: Low-cost hydrogen cell startup Protonas bags funding in round led by Transition VC
item.description: The company aims to deploy its solutions to offer cost-effective backup power applications in the North American markets. Additionally, it aims to power fuel cell engines for three-wheeler transportation and four-wheeler delivery applications in India and other Asian markets.

item.title: Hinduja Tech signs definitive agreement to acquire TECOSIM Group
item.description: Hinduja Tech is focused on expanding its mobility engineering services worldwide. The acquisition of TECOSIM Group, which employs over 650 people, will give Hinduja Tech a significant foothold in Europe. This move is intended to broaden the company's geographic reach and provide access to key customer accounts in the region.
